Tannin Characteristics: Fine-grained and balanced, providing structure without harshness.
Body Characteristics: Full, well-structured, harmonious; fresh softness and savory, round flavor.
Finish Characterstics: Lingering savory finish with a soft, round close.
Aroma: Red fruit, mature cherry, raspberry, and sweet notes of tobacco.
Flavor: Juicy cherry and raspberry with a touch of sweet tobacco and earthy depth.
Vinification: In steel tanks. 10–12 days maceration with skins using a soft 'shower' system. Malolactic fermentation in steel.
Maturation: Aged 12 months in large oak casks before bottle refinement. Minimum aging of 18 months.
General Recommended Accompanies: Cured meats, pasta with meat sauce, risotto, fillet, guinea fowl, medium-aged goat cheeses.
Stella Recommended: Gnocchi di Patate “Nonna Nilla” (Italian sausage and porcini ragu), Rigatoni al Ragu di Maiale, Filetto
Summary: Cipressi from Nizza DOCG is a **full-bodied**, **expressive Barbera** crafted with care at the La Court vineyard in Calamandrana. Inspired by the symbolic cypress trees and the rugged beauty of the land, it offers **bright red fruit**, **soft spice**, and a **harmonious savory finish**.

Tannin Characteristics: Velvety and fine, softened by oak ageing.
Body Characteristics: Amazingly fresh and rich, with silky acidity and pleasant texture.
Aroma: Wide and vinous with notes of violet, cherry, currant, plum, and spices.
Flavor: Fresh and balanced with vibrant fruit, velvety texture, and hints of oak.
Vinification: Must is cooled before fermentation in stainless steel at controlled temperature. Medium maceration using délestage for over 18 days.
Maturation: Aged for 8 months in medium-size oak casks.
Color: Deep ruby red with typical purple hues.
General Recommended Accompanies: Pasta, risotto, roasted meats, cheese, and salami.
Stella Recommended: Gnocchi di Patate “Nonna Nilla” (Italian sausage and porcini ragu), Rigatoni al Ragu di Maiale, Maiale con Pancetta e Aglio
Summary: Pajena Barbera d’Alba DOC 2021 by Enrico Serafino showcases the elegance and richness of Barbera, with fresh acidity, velvety texture, and deep fruit expression. Crafted from hand-harvested grapes and aged in large oak casks, it is both impressive and balanced.

Tannin Characteristics: Firm but refined, with a velvety edge and integrated structure.
Body Characteristics: Full-bodied and velvety with a persistent, balanced finish.
Finish Characterstics: Persistent aftertaste with soft structure and elegant balance.
Aroma: Complex aromas of red fruit and hints of spices.
Flavor: Red fruit, soft spice, velvety texture, and a long, balanced finish.
Vinification: Grapes were destemmed and crushed, followed by 8 days of skin maceration at a max of 30°C. Malolactic fermentation completed before end of winter.
Maturation: Aged approximately one year in oak barrels of varying capacities.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Filetto
Summary: Prunotto Barbaresco 2021 is a refined and expressive Nebbiolo from Treiso and Neive. Aged for one year in large oak barrels, it delivers complex red fruit and spice aromas with a velvety, full-bodied texture and long, balanced finish.

Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Spezzatino al Barolo
Tannin Characteristics: Structured and soft, showing approachability and polish despite firm tannin presence.
Body Characteristics: Excellent structure, harmony and elegance with balanced fruit and firm but soft tannins.
Aroma: Ripe black cherry, cinnamon-spiced cake, candied blood orange zest, and a hint of fresh bay leaf.
Flavor: Classic Barolo expression with integrated tannins, balanced fruit, and long aging potential.
Vinification: Fermented in stainless steel; skin contact and maceration for about 25–30 days.
Maturation: Aged about 30 months in large French oak 'botti', with a small portion in barriques.
Type of cask: Large French oak botti and some barriques
Vineyard: Multiple vineyards: Serralunga d’Alba (Ornato, La Serra, Briccolina), Grinzane Cavour (Gustava, Garretti), La Morra (Roncaglie), Novello (Ravera), Monforte (Mosconi)
Summary: Pio Cesare Barolo 2019 is a classic DOCG Nebbiolo crafted from a blend of top vineyard sites across Barolo. Aged for 30 months in large French oak with a touch of barrique, it balances structure, elegance, and aging potential with soft tannins and harmonious fruit.

Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Spezzatino al Barolo
Tannin Characteristics: Elegant, firm tannins with potential for long aging and structural depth.
Body Characteristics: Full-bodied, classic and well-structured with aging potential and evolving complexity.
Finish Characterstics: Persistent with complexity that evolves over time.
Aroma: Broad spectrum of aromas from spicy notes to sweeter floral and fruity tones.
Flavor: Structured and expressive, offering floral, fruity, and spicy layers with firm Nebbiolo character.
Vinification: Long fermentation and maceration in oak fermenters ('tini') around 30°C. Aged in large Slavonian oak casks up to 30 months, followed by bottle aging in cool, dark cellars.
Maturation: Up to 30 months in large Slavonian oak, plus bottle aging.
Vineyard: Multiple vineyards across the Barolo hills
General Recommended Accompanies: Red meats (especially game), dishes with truffle, fresh egg pasta with meat sauce, risotto, medium-mature cow’s and goat’s milk cheeses.
Summary: Massolino Barolo DOCG 2019 represents a traditional, high-level expression of Barolo using fruit from various terroirs. Aged in Slavonian oak for up to 30 months, it offers floral, spicy, and fruity notes with firm tannins, elegant balance, and great aging potential.
Sustainability: Sustainable viticulture practices, including organic fertilization and minimal intervention in the vineyard.

Tannin Characteristics: Firm and high in acidity, with structure from rare alpine soil composition.
Body Characteristics: Full-bodied with rich fruit and spice; well-structured and elegant.
Finish Characterstics: Long and smooth with spice and fruit complexity.
Aroma: Red fruit, blackberry, plum, and licorice with hints of vanilla and leather.
Flavor: Cherry, raspberry, and spice with depth from the terroir and aging.
Vinification: Crushed and macerated for 15 days in stainless steel; fermentation and post-fermentation in stainless for 3–4 months.
Maturation: 30 months in Slavonian oak casks, followed by bottle aging.
Type of cask: Slavonian oak casks of different sizes
Color: Deep ruby red with garnet reflections
Vineyard: Estate vineyards in Gattinara (Monte Rosa foothills)
General Recommended Accompanies: Grilled meats, aged cheeses, hearty dishes.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco di Vitello, Scottadito di Agnello, Spezzatino al Barolo
Summary: **Travaglini Gattinara 2013** is a **full-bodied, high-acidity Nebbiolo** from the **rocky, mineral-rich soils** of **Gattinara DOCG** in **Piedmont**. With **aromas of red fruit, blackberry, plum, and leather**, it delivers **intense cherry and raspberry flavors** with **firm tannins** and a **long, smooth finish**. Aged **30 months in Slavonian oak**, this wine reflects its **alpine terroir** and **winemaking heritage**.

Wine Name: Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino
Tannin Characteristics: Silky and elegant, with freshness and vibrancy that reflect the terroir.
Body Characteristics: Fresh and savory with structure and balance, expressing Brunello’s classic style.
Finish Characterstics: Persistent and defined by citrus, delicate spice, and vanilla notes.
Aroma: Complex bouquet of cherries, black cherries, blood orange, violets, vanilla, and light balsamic notes.
Flavor: Fresh and savory with elegant tannins, citrus fruit, spices, and vanilla hints.
Vinification: Grapes were destemmed, gently crushed, and fermented in stainless steel. Maceration for 12 days at 28°C. Aged two years in 30–80 hl oak barrels, then bottled for extended aging.
Maturation: Two years in large oak barrels followed by extended bottle aging.
Vineyard: Pian delle Vigne Estate, 6 km SW of Montalcino
General Recommended Accompanies: Braised meats, roasted game, aged cheeses, and rich pasta dishes.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco, Spezzatini, lasagna Filetto Bolognese
Summary: **Pian delle Vigne Brunello di Montalcino 2019** is a **vibrant, elegant Sangiovese** from the **historic Pian delle Vigne Estate** in **Tuscany**. Aged **two years in large oak barrels** and **refined in bottle**, it delivers **aromas of cherry, blood orange, violet, and balsamic notes**, with a **silky palate**, **fresh acidity**, and a **long, citrus-driven finish**. A classic Brunello from the renowned Antinori family.

Wine Name: Le Ragose Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
Tannin Characteristics: Firm and velvety tannins with depth and structure.
Body Characteristics: Powerful and intense, with richness and volume on the palate.
Finish Characterstics: Long and persistent, with spicy and dried fruit nuances.
Aroma: Rich aromas of ripe cherries, plums, and dried figs, with undertones of spice and tobacco.
Flavor: Deep and intense flavors of dark fruits, dried cherries, cocoa, and warm spice.
Vinification: Traditional Amarone method with grape drying (appassimento) followed by slow fermentation.
Maturation: Aged for 36 months in large oak barrels and further refined in bottle.
Vineyard: Hillside vineyards near Negrar and Valpolicella Classica area
General Recommended Accompanies: Braised beef, aged cheeses, stews, and dark chocolate desserts.
Summary: **Le Ragose Amarone della Valpolicella Classico 2015** is a **powerful and age-worthy Amarone** made using the **traditional appassimento method** in the **Valpolicella Classico** zone. Aged **36 months in large oak barrels**, it shows **rich aromas of cherries, figs, and spice**, and a **velvety, full-bodied palate** with a **long, intense finish**. A benchmark wine from the **hillsides of Negrar**, ideal for pairing with hearty dishes and aged cheeses.

Blend: 85% Sangiovese Grosso, Canaiolo Nero, Colorino, Merlot
Tannin Characteristics: Mature and balanced tannins, slightly dry, warm and extroverted.
Body Characteristics: Robust and warm with valid persistence.
Finish Characterstics: Fresh-sapid axis with a mature tannin, good length.
Aroma: Scents of wild fruits and cherries, violets, roses, aromatic herbs and fine spices.
Flavor: Warm, slightly tannic and sapid with a full-bodied, balanced profile.
Vinification: Fermentation and maceration in truncated, conical stainless steel vats for 15–20 days.
Maturation: 14–16 months aging in French oak barriques and tonneaux (two-thirds), and vats (one-third).
Type of cask: French oak barriques and tonneaux, and large vats
Color: Ruby red with slight orange hues
Stella Recommended: Rigatoni al Ragu Maiale, Mail con pancetta e Aglio, Filetto
Summary: **Poliziano Vino Nobile di Montepulciano 2021** is an **organic red wine** from **Tuscany**, made with **Sangiovese Grosso and local varieties**. It features **wild fruit, violets, and spice aromas**, a **full-bodied palate**, and **warm, persistent tannins**. Aged 14–16 months in French oak and vats, it reflects Montepulciano’s terroir and sustainability.

Tannin Characteristics: Firm and pleasant tannins, richly vinous texture.
Body Characteristics: Flavourful and structured with good balance.
Aroma: Floral hints of rose and violet, with aromatic herbs.
Flavor: Bright ruby with a great sensory orchestra on the palate, expressive and flavorful.
Vinification: Maceration with délestage and rackings in stainless steel at 28°C for about 15 days.
Maturation: 10–12 months in 225L toasted French oak barrels (33% rotation), plus at least 3 months in bottle
Vineyard: Tenuta di Nozzole, Greve in Chianti at 280–380m
General Recommended Accompanies: Beefsteak Florentine-style, white beans with olive oil.
Stella Recommended: Lasagna con Filetto, Penne All Arrabbiata, Filetto
Summary: **Nozzole Chianti Classico 2021** is a **100% Sangiovese** red from **Greve in Chianti**. Aged 10–12 months in French oak, it offers **floral aromas**, **firm tannins**, and **bright ruby color**, capturing the elegance and structure of the 2021 vintage in Tuscany.

Wine Name: Tenuta di Arceno Chianti Classico Riserva
Tannin Characteristics: Firm and well-integrated tannins that support aging.
Body Characteristics: Structured and rich with intense fruit concentration.
Finish Characterstics: Persistent with notes of herbs and oak spice.
Aroma: Black cherry, dried rose petals, savory herbs, and subtle spice.
Flavor: Dark fruits, licorice, earth tones, with hints of balsamic and oak.
Vinification: Fermented in stainless steel tanks with extended maceration.
Maturation: 12 months in French oak (20% new), followed by 6 months in bottle.
Vineyard: Tenuta di Arceno estate, Castelnuovo Berardenga
General Recommended Accompanies: Red meats, aged cheeses, wild game, and savory pasta dishes.
Summary: **Tenuta di Arceno Chianti Classico Riserva 2019** blends **90% Sangiovese** with **10% Cabernet Sauvignon**. Aged in French oak, this wine offers rich notes of **black cherry, dried flowers, and savory herbs**, showcasing the structure and elegance of the **Chianti Classico Riserva** style.

Tannin Characteristics: Soft and elegant tannins with subtle hints of wood.
Body Characteristics: Balanced structure with refined texture and freshness from high-altitude vineyards.
Finish Characterstics: Persistent with delicate spice and fruit tones.
Aroma: Primary aromas of fresh red fruits with floral and herbal nuances.
Flavor: Expressive red cherry, plum, and a touch of vanilla and spice from oak aging.
Vinification: Fermented in stainless steel tanks at 25–28°C with 12-day maceration; full malolactic fermentation.
Maturation: Aged 12 months in 225L French oak barrels (20% new, 80% used).
General Recommended Accompanies: Lamb, roasted meats, aged cheeses, and rich pasta dishes.
Stella Recommended: Scottadito, Spezzatino, Gnocchi Nonna Nilla gorgonzola sauce
Summary: **Tenuta Regaleali Lamùri** is a **refined Sicilian Nero d’Avola** grown at **high altitudes** to preserve **elegance and freshness**. Aged in **French oak barrels**, it expresses **aromas of cherry, spice, and vanilla**, with a **balanced palate and silky tannins**, making it an **excellent pairing for grilled meats and aged cheeses**.

Wine Name: Nino Negri Valtellina Superiore DOCG Quadrio
Tannin Characteristics: Elegant tannins offering structure without overwhelming dryness.
Body Characteristics: Full and vigorous with lively structure and freshness.
Finish Characterstics: Clean, with lingering fruit and savory tones.
Aroma: Berry fruit, raspberry jam, roses, violets, and grassy undertones.
Flavor: Ethereal and complex with fruit and floral depth balanced by fresh minerality.
Vinification: Traditional vinification followed by aging in oak.
Maturation: Aged 18 months in large French and Slavonian oak vats.
Vineyard: Steep terraces in the heart of Valtellina near Castello Quadrio
General Recommended Accompanies: Game, roasted red meats, and mature cheeses.
Stella Recommended: Milanese do Pollo, Maiale con Pancetta e Aglio, Spaghetti Bolognese
Summary: **2020 Nino Negri Valtellina Superiore DOCG Quadrio** is a unique expression of **Nebbiolo** softened by **Merlot**, grown on Valtellina’s steep terraces. Aged 18 months in oak, it offers aromas of **raspberry jam and violets**, with **elegant tannins and vibrant drinkability**, showcasing the character of its historic Castello Quadrio home.

Blend: Corvina Veronese and Corvinone Veronese 75%, Rondinella 25%
Wine Name: Campagnola Amarone della Valpolicella DOCG Classico
Tannin Characteristics: Round and rich with well-integrated tannins from long oak aging.
Body Characteristics: Full-bodied, structured with a velvety texture.
Finish Characterstics: Lingering notes of ripe plum, vanilla, and toasted almond.
Aroma: Powerful bouquet with intense aromas of cherry, ripe plum, toasted almond, and vanilla.
Flavor: Rich and round with notes of ripe fruit, almond, and spice.
Vinification: Soft pressing of dried grapes in December/January, followed by 30-day skin maceration.
Maturation: 60% aged 24 months in large oak barrels (20–50 hl), 40% aged 18 months in new French barriques (Allier), plus 6 months in bottle.
Type of cask: Large oak barrels and new French barriques
Color: Deep bright ruby red with violet edge
Vineyard: Hillside vineyards in Marano di Valpolicella, 200–350 m a.s.l., calcareous soil
General Recommended Accompanies: Game, roasted and grilled meats, full-flavored dishes, mature cheeses.
Stella Recommended: Osso Buco, Scottadito, Gnocchi with Gorgonzola Sauce
Summary: **Campagnola Amarone della Valpolicella Classico** is crafted from **hand-selected grapes naturally dried for 100 days**, then aged in both **large oak** and **French barriques**. This **full-bodied Amarone** delivers rich layers of **cherry, plum, almond, and vanilla**, with a **long, elegant finish**.

Tannin Characteristics: Moderate tannins with a gentle, smooth finish.
Body Characteristics: Round and plush texture with balanced structure.
Aroma: Morello and sour cherry, prune, floral and spice notes.
Flavor: Rich red fruit flavors with floral and spicy undertones.
Vinification: Must macerates for 6–8 days in stainless steel tanks.
Maturation: 6 months in American oak barriques, followed by 2 months bottle aging.
Color: Ruby red with delicate garnet undertones
Vineyard: Various vineyard sites in Salento, sandy soil, 20–40m elevation
General Recommended Accompanies: Pizza, pasta with red sauce, baked dishes, seafood like tuna or swordfish.
Summary: **Cantele Primitivo** is a **plush and flavorful red wine** from Puglia, offering **ripe cherry and prune aromas** with **floral and spice hints**. Aged in **American oak**, this wine balances **fruit, tannin, and acidity** for a **smooth, satisfying finish**—perfect with **pasta, pizza**, and even **seafood**.

Tannin Characteristics: Moderate tannins typical of Barbera and Nebbiolo, with structure retained by steel aging.
Body Characteristics: Fresh and balanced due to cool fermentation and stainless steel aging.
Finish Characteristics: Clean and crisp with bright red fruit notes lingering on the palate.
Aroma: Bright red fruit and subtle floral hints.
Flavor: Red berries, tangy acidity, and fresh finish.
Vinification: Hand-harvested grapes fermented and aged in stainless steel at cool temperatures.
Maturation: Aged in stainless steel to preserve freshness.
Vineyard: Vineyards located in the Langhe and Monferrato
General Recommended Accompanies: Great with pizza, pasta with red sauce, grilled vegetables, and cured meats.
Stella Recommended: Gnocchi di Patate “Nonna Nilla” (Italian sausage and porcini ragu), Rigatoni al Ragu di Maiale, Pollo alla Parmigiana
Summary: Barbera 'Vezzi' by Gotham Project is a fresh, vibrant red from Langhe and Monferrato in Piemonte. Made from 90% Barbera and 10% Nebbiolo, it’s fermented and aged in stainless steel for crispness and energy. Sustainable farming practices highlight the fruit purity and bright acidity.
Sustainability: Sustainable farming practices are used in the vineyard.

Tannin Characteristics: Finely integrated tannin structure gently supports the palate.
Body Characteristics: Harmonious palate of saturated dark red fruits with a smooth structure.
Finish Characteristics: Lingering notes of toast, vanilla, and dried dark fruits.
Aroma: Savory rosemary and forest floor, black raspberry, with toasty oak spice.
Flavor: Dried cherry, blackberry, plum, with a hint of vanilla and toast.
Vinification: Grapes from different terrains of Tuscany fermented and blended to reflect regional characteristics.
Maturation: Not specified in detail; includes exposure to oak contributing toast and vanilla notes.
Vineyard: Valdarno hills and Chianti region; Merlot & Syrah from marlstone-rich soil, Sangiovese from high elevation vineyards.
General Recommended Accompanies: Pastas, meat dishes, charcuterie, pizza, and blue cheese.
Summary: The Merlot & Syrah are produced in the Valdarno hills where the soil is rich in marlstone and clay; the sun is notably bright, but nights are cool – important for optimum ripening of these grapes. The Sangiovese is planted at the highest elevation of the Chianti region. This wine expresses the fresh scents and balanced flavors associated with the vineyards of Castello di Querceto
